values:
Tommorrow I am married. My condolences to the single ladies out there. For those who care, Emily and I will journal occasionally from our honeymoon destination of OSAKA JAPAN!!! Sweet!

theweedmans.blogspot.com

Read it or weep.

Hi. Um...remember me. I guess I'm gonna post now. Just so everyone knows, I am getting married to beautiful Emily A Fields (soon to be Mrs. Weedman)this saturday Oct 7th. And let me just say this, you learn a LOT about EVERYBODY planning a wedding. I have learned...
1) That Emily really is my best friend, and at times it feels like my only ally
2) Certain friends/family members who mask themselves as "well-wishers" and "supporters" really only care about their own selfish interests.
3) Just because you are 50 or older doesn't mean you can't act like a toddler in the toy aisle.
4) Emily is gorgeous when she cries from happiness. I am ugly whenever I cry for any reason.
5) Some people don't understand that others grow, mature, and progress to a different person than they were 3 years prior. (Eg my mother still says I hate to eat anything green because she thinks it's funny. In reality I often go through Vegetarian phases because it increases my endurance and cuts my weight for fights. And I miss spinach.)
6) There are those in the business world who prey upon emotionally fragile brides-to-be and they should all be choke slammed one by one. By yours truly.
7) Hanging around my in-laws makes my protective/savior complex flare up and makes me glad emily and I are honeymooning on the other side of the globe (japan. Woot.) This way nobody can contact us. Only us to them.

All in all this has been a good experience, but it's fun to write these things out to vent a little bit. Who knows, I may start up on this whole "blogging" thing again! In the meantime, I just started the myspace craze. Join me?

www.myspace.com/louisvillebrent

Random post time.

There are two pieces of Brent-things that are note worthy.
1) I have a mohawk. I'm serious.
2) I fight in Evansville on May 20th. 730 CST (830 Louisville Time)

If I get 10 people from Livejournal to go, then I will keep the mohawk for all to see. Tickets are $15 from me, $5 cheaper than at the door. And a portion of all my ticket sales will go to yours truly, so come on out and KEEP THE SCENE ALIVE!!!!

Si se puede.
Brent

Hi. I'm Brent. You may remember me from such websites as "livejournal.com" and "hellojapaniamyourmostawesomeking.com" I have the internet now, so you may occasionally be blessed with a pos t of mine. Proper thanks may be shown by way of financial donation. My most recent developments are as such...
Emily and I got a great new townhouse of of westport road...and a new dog named fletcher.
My fighting addiction has taken on new heights. Current MMA record...5-0-1
I have lost over 28 pounds since may. I am skinny.
I am in the best shape of my life since training tons and tons of kettlebells (google it ladies).
Politically, I am preparing my soul to vote anybody in as commander in chief before Hilary Clinton in 2008. This is including, but not limited to...
lucifer
the chupacabra
kimbo slice
dave crowder (the drinker, not the singer).
She makes me feel the way Bush v2.0 makes you all feel.

AAAAAANYways...there is a ufc special on right now. You should all be watching it now.
Later.

I love emily,
Brent

Um...hi everyone. Sorry I dont post much. I'm a busy guy. And I dont have the internet, so I only use it at my parents. Here's an update.

1) I fought in an MMA tourny (in a cage) July 2 in a four man 205 lbs bracket. I won both fights by strikes on the ground.
2) Chuck Liddel's manager (www.ufc.tv) is coming to meet me in August. He might start setting up fights for me.
3) I'm still engaged. Emily is happily tied up in the closet of my bedroom. (She has books to keep her company. Mostly pre-approved histories of the third reich.)
4) I'm a manager at GNC now. Its in lagrange, which sucks a little.
5) My grandmother (Dad's mom) died thursday morning at 3 am. She knew the Lord, and is in a better place than in a run down old body that didnt hardly function anymore.
6) I will make an effort to reply to people who write on this post. SOrry about the absence.

Love to everyone except hippies and the french,
Brent

Ok, so I have been pleasantly surprised by a few posts/emails asking for an update to my life. Here goes... I moved out by myself, Dustin didnt really want to because of school possibilities. I work two jobs now, the usual UPS and i went back to GNC. I am planning on quiting UPS after this semester to go into GNC management. I am still in school full time, bringing my average school/work week to a meek 64-70 hours. I am still madly in love with Emily. I will be marrying her. I will most likely apply for the police department in june or july :::crosses fingers::: I have only been training during the rare times that I am not working. I work out mostly with some cop friends of mine, which is cool because we fight with knives and take the slides off of guns and train with those. (*FYI at this point, anybody who pulled a gun on me would be signing their death warrant) I am very disappointed in most of my old friends. So here is what I have decided to do, and have been doing for a while. People that I care about deeply are acting exceedingly immature and dangerously, and destroying any desire I would have to see them. So what Im doing is allowing them to live foolishly and still have the gall to wonder why they are depressed/feel like they have no direction whilst I sit on the sidelines. Because I would rather miss out on their company now and wait for them to outgrow it (God-willing) than to hang out with them now and be so disgusted with them that I forever lose any desire to see them again. My prayers are with these people, and I only hope they grow up before hurting themselves or somebody else. Its all kinda cliche until it happens to your friends. Ce la vie. (sp?) I sincerely hope that all of you find and live a meaningful existance. God Bless. Brent

My day of birth was yesterday. I turned twenty one. WOO 21! It was a great day. Me and Emily went to Maido and ate the only true japanese food in louisville (it has VASTLY improved). Then we went to Jillians, because some of her friends were there. They were all really cool. I drank with them. A lot. For the first time in over 10 years, I got sick. I felt stupid, but I think I was set up...

New apartment alert. Me and Poopy D(ustin) are gonna move to some siQQQ apartments behind Mall St. Matthews. They are sick. Did I say that already? Wurd.


Love peace and afro greece.
Brent

I won the US Sabaki Capital Challenge, heavyweight division. (See: www.virginiakarate.com eventually) Two fights, to Knockouts. First was a knee to my opponents jaw. Second a kick to the face. I felt really bad, however, because they were REALLY great guys, and they both had to go to the hospital. I saw the first guy later that night at the after party, and he had 7 stitches. He said the other guy had a broken nose (which I just found out dustin captured on tape when he stood up. Its NASTY) and a concussion, but would be fine. I made a lot of great connections and good friends. Just doing my part to put Byakuren on the map.

OSU!!

My girlfriend is the greatest writer in the history of the pencil. She wrote a poem yesterday for a creative writing class, and hated it. After MUCH begging and pleading, she let me read it. Its amazing. I read it again just now before bed, and it really brought tears to my eyes. NOBODY has ever understood me like this, much less had the EXACT same thoughts and feelings. I dont deserve this at all, and I will treat each day as the undeserved gift that it is.

Whew...

I got a new car. Woot. It is a 2001 Ford Taurus, and SIGNIFICANTLY cooler than it sounds. When the guy called me and told me he found it, my reaction was "Cool." 
But then I saw it...
And then I drove it...
Holy crap Im happy. And its a nice family car, so one day I will fill it with babies.
I love you (her)

How's everybody? I have been busy to the maxxx and havent seen many people lately. Here's something stupid, I have friends (no one in particular is on my mind) that as soon as you get busy and cant hang out as much they stop liking you. They assume that I think Im too good for them. Isnt that funny? So here's my schedule, for any potential naysayers. Work: Sunday-Thursday 10 pm-630 am Sleep: 730ish am-1/130pm School: Mon-Thurs 2 pm-530pm Karate (officially): Tues 70-930 Add about 2-3 hours of homework a week (most from my JA 521 class which is a writing course. At least 5 pages a week, plus working on a 20 minute lesson/6 page paper on the Jim Bakker "Praise the Lord" white collar crime case). I go to church about 3 times a month, and hang out with Emily whenever possible (usually because I see here on campus and/or for a few minutes before I go to work). So, naysayers, I still love all of you. But its hard to split time with all of your friends between Fri/Sat nights only. Plus, I have little to no interest in going to a party and getting shitty every weekend. And Im sorry to say this, but many of my good friends arent as much fun when they're drunk. They're more...whats the word...one dimensional. I wish drinking wasnt as cool right now. Hopefully the pattern of my friends will follow suit as it always has. Something becomes THE thing to do, they do it every available moment, then it dies done to moderation and we sit around and laugh about when we used to be SOOO into it. Examples...drinking, poker, about 1 million different bands, ect. Lots of love to everybody. Emily makes me happy and actualizes all of the potential I had to be a man. Love, Brent

You Are 33 Years Old
33
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?

You know how new couples always say "I love you more and more everyday." I was thinking hard today about this, and I dont know that I've met more than one or two couples who can say that honestly. And before God I can say that this is true for me. Hm. Thoughts? Questions?

tell me three things you don't like about me. then when you're done, post this on your journal and see what others don't like about you. Am I really doing this? This is the worst idea ever. None of that "I dont like how awesome you are!" REAL problems, people.

My father is a smart man. Things are already better. Just to be sure, it's not that I overreacted yesterday...it's just that my family acted TOTALLY out of nature. We'll see if it lasts. School...bring it on. I kicked the shit out of a nation of chinky-eyed-bannana-colored-people, I can take you too...(*with the help of my girlfriend) Grrrr.... Me and Emily warming up to kick school's ass. I'm going for the eyes...

Life was going too well for a while, and then decided enough was enough. I may have made some decisions that screw up a major part of my life, at least for a while. Way to go dipshit. My parents are damn close to hating me, and I may have ruined the legitimacy of mine and Emily's relationship for them. Dogmas, by the way, are a pretty terrible thing to live by. Lots of people would be happier if they agreed to disagree. Here's to better times. Here's to being a man. Here's to my father, even though he never hears this and never believes me when I say he made me all that I am...

here's to true love that won't fade.
Here's to Emily and me.

Ganbattemasu

Content. Nice.

Today my parents got a new couch and recliner delivered to their home. Now I will never leave. It is what the Germans call a certain "San Diago"  which of course in German means "the whale's vagina."

Emily. Wow. If you havent met her yet...RUN...dont walk. And MAYBE if you kiss her ass (not literally unless you want yours kicked) she will allow you 5 minutes of her precious time. Then you must kiss her rings and back away staring at the ground.

Jake is the coolest dog ever. I missed not seeing him much for a few days. But we're going to hang out here for a while.

This week Petar and I record the new stuff...

The Packers are currently beating the Chicago Chipmunks 31-14.

If anyone can tell me where I got the "chicago Chipmunks" from will receive two points. No, no...three. 

I love you all,
Brent

I have been the BIGGEST LOSER EVER lately. So here's why...I've gotten time off work for the holidays, I'm off school, and I have shitloads of time to kill. So the latest in my nerd-dom...TAKE MY QUIZ!! Anyone who gets a 10 will get a kiss on the lips from me. DO IT NOW!!! Take yo best shot biyatch! and then What'd ya get nigga?!

TRAGEDY. This morning, the greatest defensive end to play the game, Reggie White, died after a massive heart attack at the age of 43. Reggie White redefined the position, but more importantly was renowned as a Godly man. He has publicly been called bigoted, racist, close minded, and foolish for his faith, and it never mattered. Now ol Reg and I didnt always agree on matters of faith, but I ALWAYS held him in the highest respect. He was an excellent father, husband, friend of the community, and minister to his church. He will be missed. See you in heaven buddy.

ATTN: If ANYBODY can locate the soon to be mentioned hoodie for me and GET IT IN MY HANDS...They will be paid $50.

The hoodie is usually navy blue, it says "Overcome" on the front with some sort of angel design. On the back it say "Content is the man who realizes that his worth relies in Christ." 

It was my favorite hoodie. Nicole stole it, and then lost it. I am heated. I want it more than my next 5 minutes of oxygen.

Help me.

Im on the phone with someone I love.
Here are five words she uses to describe me. Im writing them as she speaks. Really.

1) Thoughtful
2) Outgoing
3) Trustworthy
4) Sexy
5) Loyal


Life rules.

I love my life. It is interesting to think that for those of you who read this and dont know me too well probably think that I am a very up and down person. Aside from having had some very high ups and low downs in my life, this is simply not true. I just dont post very often (except for recently) and many of these changes seem very close together. I have never been happier. NO ONE has ever made me smile as much as Emily Anne Fields (no relation to the cookie). If I were to die in my sleep tonight, it would be a happy death...with a big ass smile on my face. But instead I think I will live, and see where this wild ride takes me.

Content and loved (finally),
Brent

Another post?!?! What are you, a SCENE KID?!?! No. Im bored. So here are some pictures/people that evoke in me extreme happiness and/or love. These honestly make me smile. But what doesnt nowadays? WARNING: MAAAAAD Pictures!!! Man oh man I love Dave. Hehe. We were drunk. HOLY FUCK! ITS THE CHUPACABRA!!! You cant hide forever you bastard... Yes he does, sweetheart. (*that shirt says 'daddy drinks because I cry) Best friend #1 Dustin met slash. Then he told him that the new velvet revolver song sucks ass. Brent sleepy. Brent wrap tshirt on head. Brent sleep with arms cross because Brent rules. Best friend #2 doing his best Brent impression. (left) Shut up Emily. Nobody is afraid of you. Aint that the truth? Aint that the truth? Jamie 10 seconds before making out with her blue bunny. Brent sleepy again... I met Genki Sudo. He's so much hotter than me. "I wonder how much Brent loves me?" Dustin pouted... "This much, my love," responded Brent. I love you all. And I love my little Crab Cakes.

Life rules. Emily is amazing, and I only say amazing because my vocabulary fails me at this point. Went to a "party" last night, which translates to watching drunk frat bros play darts. Somebody PLEASE break a stereotype, it wont hurt. I promise.  But I saw an old friend, which was cool. Also "met" Emily's ex-boyperson. He looked like he wanted to steal me. Somebody should forward him the memo...Bad Idea. Life is grand right now. Im busy with work, put in a new application to get myself out of the hell that is called UPS SCS. 

Everybody have fun at Casey Jones tonight, watch out for each other...

Love. Peace. Chicken Fingers.
Brent.

I declare today the day of BRENT AND EMILY!!!



COMMENCE AWESOMENESS!!!!!!!
*OSU*
My family is great. My friends are great. My life is great. And you...yes YOU...are great.

Today the paper reported about a 75 year old man shot and killed by Officer John Grissom. The poor innocent victim's brother refered to the police officer as a "trigger happy cop" and said he "hoped to hell" that the cop could live with himself. Let me tell you why that officer can and should be able to live with himself. The 75 year old man had his girlfriend around the neck in a classic movie headlock style with a knife to her chest. Officer Grissom was at high ready (weapon raised) about 9 to 10 feet away ordering the man to drop his weapon. Stating that he would "kill the bitch," the poor innocent victim raised his knife quickly towards her neck, and Grissom shot said poor innocent victim in the face. He shot him in the FACE over the girlfriend's shoulder. Holy crap. What a shot. I would like to shake this man's hand and want to be the first person on the block to call him a hero. I am never happy when a situation ends fatally, but in cases like this the right person died. And thank GOD that Chief Robert White FINALLY stood next to his officers stating "I believe this young lady's life was probably saved as a result of the officer's actions." Thank you Chief. Now where was that sentiment when Detective Mattingly protected his own life? The sooner this community (or any community for that matter) starts thinking of these criminals as the dirt that they are, the faster we can get this proverbial "ball" called community policing rolling. PS-in other news, the girlfriend was more likely a prostitute, but I didn't get that info yet.

Ok, so everyone is doing amazing amounts of surveys and "write one things" entries lately, so I thought of a good one. I fancy myself a darn honest person, and I cant think of anything off the top of my head that I would want to keep from anyone who reads my journal (knock on wood), so here it goes. 


Anybody can ask me one "yes or no" question that I will answer honestly with no further explanation. I will probably get no responses to this, but I actually kinda want to. So please, get personal. Get embarassing. Lets DO THIS!!!

Clear the pit, you are one tuff mother. Hardcore is your life. You identify with the
hardcore scene and like nothing more than
breaking faces...especially faces that don't
belong in the pit. If the kids aren't moshing
your way, you lay down the law and get them off
the dance floor by any means necessary. Oh, and
you're probably Edge as crap.

How TUFF are you?
brought to you by Quizilla Bitches. Two mistakes...Hardcore=NOT my life, Edge=NOT me. Other than that, I am tougher than chinese algebra. I could beat up all of your alls dads. At once. Grrrr....

Here is yours truly fighting in the sea of Japan at summer training. Its kind of a wide shot buy HEY LADIES...My SHIRT IS OFF! And Im thowing a knee strike so my tum tum is all rolled up and disgusting Im sure. I need to become gay. All gay guys are ripped to shreds with awesome abs. If I was gay, I could get ALL THE LADIES!!! Woot.

So I have met a girl who, without hesitation, rules at life harder than anyone I have met for a while. I have never been with someone that I was both romantically interested in whilst wanting nothing more than to just hang out with her. This combination could prove both lucrative and dangerous all at once. And it makes me feel stupid for looking back just months ago at all the angst caused by a certain Nicole, who shall remain nameless. But wouldnt you know it, she understands THAT too! Wow. So please join me in raising your glass to Emily, queen of the night. Or something. Salude.

I thought I would just tag on (since my last post was actually read) that when I decided that I was going to live my life as a Christian for the first time, and everytime I reach a new understanding of what this means, I feel free and liberated. Those of you who have been burnt by the church or another "christian" PLEASE understand this and accept my apologies on behalf of somebody who is making a bad name for me. The God I worship is a God of love, compassion, forgiveness, and FREEDOM. I DONT do the things I feel are right because otherwise I would burn in eternal hellfire, I do them out of gratitude for this life that I have been blessed with and my desire for others to find this "eternal relaxation" for lack of a better "christianese" slogan. So thats that. No more serious talk for a while, Im spent. And you. Yes YOU. I KNOW you are perusing my livejournal for juicy tidbits and just know this...I SEE DEAD PEOPLE... I mean I SEE YOU. ;-)

A christian huh? Go figure. But coming in at a close second....cult. You may call me "Brother Brent X." I would like to state for the record that I am unshamedly and unapologetically christian, but I AM ashamed of most christians that I run across. For you history buffs, remember when the teachings of Jesus were a MOVEMENT? A REVOLUTION? Not a BUILDING or a DOGMA. Oh wait, its still like that in many places of the world. There are statistically more martyrs of the christian faith today than there has been over the last 2000 years. But here in the good ol US of A, most christians are too busy wading in the pool of self righteous cow shit to actually demonstrate any true love or compassion for anyone. Fuck I have to stop talking, because Im going to get myself mad. Im going to sit here and wait for the call from my "special friend." SHHHHWIIIIING! (*For those of you who said 'Wayne's World,' stretch your hand towards the sky with your palm facing behind you and swing down to pat yourself on the back. Everybody else, subtract two points and skip a turn.)
Im just going to say that just when you were wishing for things to go good for you...BAM! You meet your female doppelganger. Seriously, this girl ROOLZ!!!!11

dustin vancleave is love
brought to you by the isLove Generator
HHHHHHHHHHHHHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHAHAHA!!! I thought Id do one just to see what the fuss was about. HOW PERFECT! My best friend in the whole world, and I JUST SPENT THE NIGHT with him at his parents house! I would tell you how it went, but Im not that kinda boy. Lets just say, the parents new shower is HUGE. PS-Nana, I had the most RANDOM dream ever where there was this girl madly in love with me and always calling me and coming over (I lived in Japan by the way). Like many of my dreams I never really saw the face until the end, and it was you! WEEEEEEEEEIRD. (but a little cool) BUT WEEEEEIRD!!!!

Im almost definately going to fight in America. Jan 29 in Virginia and the last saturday in April in Denver. People should drive to virginia. That would be cool.

Brent

Heres the part where I let everyone down. I didnt win. The guy I fought first round was an aussie named Judd Reed. He beat me in what was a very close/controversial decision after the second round. I didnt fight my best, however I did kick him in the head once that staggered him. But for whatever reason I didnt get the wazari. I was pretty damn disappointed, but Judd went on to be the only foreigner to even place in any division (4th place heavyweight). Hes won a TON of taikai and was a home student with Mas Oyama for three years starting in 1990 (With NICHOLAS PETTAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!). But anyway, this is budo. This is life. Im young, strong, and stupid. So I need to go back to training. I think Im going to enter Enshin Karates All World Championships that are held in Denver at the end of april. Im not sure, but Im going to think about it. See you guys in a couple days.

Love (collectively)
Brent

Im sitting here in the lobby of the hotel across the street from the tournament. I will walk over there in about half an hour. I feel strong. I feel ready. I feel like I am going to puke. I just want to give it my best. Please pray.



Here goes nothing...

Im here in japan. I finally saw a pic of the guy Im fighting. Bad news: he seems all business Good news: so am I. Plus I have about 18 pounds and 2 inches on him. I hope it helps. Kancho has these new Byakuren Kaikan duffel bags. Holy shit they:re hot. I love my home (Japan). Today the lady that runs the public bath I go to made me sign my picture on this poster she put up of the tournament. She wants me to win real bad! I hope I do.
Talk to you guys soon.
Osu
Brent

Went to see Saosin with Dustin last night. Saosin has been in my top 3 bands since I first got ahold of their cd, but that show moved them to #1. Seriously, if you wanted to go but didnt you need to reevaluate your priorities! Peter was fun to see, and after my 2nd show in Cinci, I finally understand why they fight so much. I almost hit people on numerous occassions. Best part of the night...during the bridge of 7 years (Dont treat me I'm to blame, dont treat me like I ever accused you) Peter and I opened it up and killed people. It was some of my finest mosh to date, I must say. I definately feel like I melted some faces off. I only save my mosh for the primest of occasions, and last night was a fine night to do so. 

Tonights training was real rough, and real real good. I feel confident about Japan. I should definately place. 

Talk to you later.
Brent

Now for my obligitory election post. This goes out to all the crybabies who got "shortchanged" by the election. "Waaaah! America got shortchanged by Bush getting reelected!" Let me staight one painfully obvious truth, America did NOT get shortchanged. Am I a Bush fan? I would say no. Did I vote for him? Yes. It honestly came down to the sheer ambiguity of Kerry and the fact that I dont trust him any more than Bush. HOWEVER!!!!!!!!!...Bush won the POPULAR vote as well as the electoral votes. This means that while YOU may not like it, 52% of the country did. Welcome to democracy. For all you who say "Well IM not happy about it and neither is anyone I know" are just as self serving as you claim Bush to be. A part of me (albeit a VERY small part) wanted Kerry to win so that I could say "Now I will lead by example and suck it up to support my President and wish that he does great things." But he didnt, Bush did. So lead by example and suck it up to support your President and wish that he does great things. 

USA! USA! USA!

Let me tell you a story. Football demigod Brett Farve mentions preseason that his team (the greatest ever, by the way) are going "Super bowl or Bust." The last time Farve said that was 1996, when the Packers won the Superbowl last. The Packers would start there season in 2004 with a challenge, defending NFC champions the Carolina Panthers at Carolina. The Packers lacked defensive depth and Farve is getting a little old, but came out impressive, defeating the Panthers and absolutely smothering them with a "take no prisoners" smash mouth defense. The next game was arch rivals the Chicago Bears at Lambeau Field, the Mecca of Football (and maybe of all professional sports). No problem, right? Wrong. Not only did the Packers lose to Chicago, but also the Giants and the Titans. All at home. The titans held the Pack to 17-0 in the FIRST QUARTER, the worst start of a packer game since 1990. (They also had time to sneak in a loss to the Colts at Indy into their busy schedule) The pack were 1-4, 0-3 at home, the worst start in well over a decade. So when the time came to play the surprising 3-1 Lions AT Detroit, a certain Karate Master was less than optimistic. The opening quarter was about what was expected. A dull 7-7. After briefly falling to 10-7, the Packers went into halftime leading 17-10, which slightly lifted my spirits. The game was close until the third quarter, when Darren Sharper intercepted a pass and ran it back 36 yards to the house. 24-10. The Lions were done. The Packers ended the game 38-10. "Old man" Farve was 25 for 38 and 257 yards. Ahman Green ran for 81 yards (the most against the Lions this year) AND threw a 20 yard TD pass in the fourth. You read that right. THREW. So now I am both confused and very happy. I guess that the Packers just need a challenge to perform. Um...I guess. So in closing, everybody with me now............ duh duh duhduh duh duh DUH... GO PACK GO!!!!!!!

You know what?! I was EXCITED to meet these two famous fighters, and then only to be disappointed that nobody would know or care about who they are!! So here's what Im gonna do...Im going to post them. And somebody, ANYBODY, just PRETEND to be interested,oK?! All my friends laughed at how star struck I am, cause to them its no big deal. Many of them actually KNOW these guys. The first one is Tsukamoto Norichika, current heavyweight kyokushin all japan champion (Midori branch), the second is Suzuki Kunihiro, the same kyokushin branches WORLD champion. Heavyweight. Hes bad as they come, and he was very very nice/friendly to me. Here they are.

We will start with Kamakura Daibutsu, Meredith. THis is simply a large buddha statue, and many cities have one. This one is in Kamakura, hence the name. Fun fact!...Once last year pranksters painted nail polish and six pack abs on it. At another shrine in Kamakura, you can buy these wood plaques and make wishes on them and the priests would pray for them. Mine is in the middle (yes, in japanese. Buts its pretty rough!) I wished to be the heavyweight champion in November, my best friends is on the right, wishing to be the lightweight champion in November. His wife is on the left wishing for both of our wishes to come true! A small girl in her traditional summer festival hapi (like a robe) Me in mine. That color blue (the sash and towel headband) is the color for the area of Kisarazu I was in. Each town has their own color. The shrine we had to carry. (A couple thousand pounds by the way) Me carrying it. It sucked. One of my best friends kids. Her name is Leah, but spelled different. She looks just like "Boo" in Monsters Inc. See? (Cue girls "awwwwww!"ing) Me and Genki Sudo. Bitches.(There are other pics I have with other famous fighters, but none of you would know them. Drat.) At Kamakura Dojo. The guy on the right is Kawai Shibucho (Shibucho means the head instructor of a dojo). Hes pretty famous, and real real good. The guy on the left is his father, Kawai Shihan (Shihan means the head of all the dojos in a section of the country) Hes real old, and real real good. My good friend Masanori Mochizuki. He lives in Kisarazu, where I did the festival. He speaks amazing english, and he is Black belt in Byakuren. Minami Takehiro. The man, the myth, the legend. I would call this guy a friend, but I wouldnt want to insult him. He and his wife consider ME a friend, but he is my hero. He is also like my personal instructor. This pic was taken at his dojo, about 30 minutes from Headquarters, which I traveled every tuesday and thursday. Minami and his wife Yoko. She is very pretty. This was after my last night at their dojo. Minami is very very nice, and very very scary. I will tell you a story later. (He threw a guy out a window) Before After. With Hazama Kancho. (Kancho means the head of a style. He is the head of Shinmei kaikan.) The best for last. Me and Sugihara Kancho, my "grandmaster." He is absolutely amazing, and could kill you with his pinkie toe. Hes also a hell of a cook. (See below) My farwell party. Kancho makes a Korean dish called Nabe. One of my favorites. His nabe almost kicks more ass than he does. Hope you enjoy them. Ask for more if you didnt see something you liked!

Ok everyone, time for some group participation. Ive finally got all of my pictures from Japan on here. What do you guys want to see? My friends? My instructors? Me and Genki Sudo? The options are limited only by your imagination (and by what I have pictures of). Please respond, I would love to show them off, but there are too many to simply put them all.
Brent

Edit:Other options...my dojo, my roommate, my friends kids (the daughter looks JUST like Boo from Monsters Inc), a shirtless before/after pic to show the weight I lost, etc

I just wanted to make something clear for those who do not see me very often. Just because I am not posting here very much doesnt mean that I am sitting alone in a room and sulking. (Not that I have been accused of that, Im just saying). I want you all to know that I am still Brent, nobody can take that from me. Without sounding too "preachery" or anything like that, there are a great number of things in my life that I hold dear and answer to that are much bigger than myself or my problems. Not the least of which are my God, my father/mother, my Karate, my true friends, my passion for life, etc. While a lesser man might sit and mope, feeling sorry for himself and generally just being annoying, I will press on. For I truly believe that "suffering produces perseverance; perseverance, character; and character, hope." This is not to say that I am "over it" or will never be sad again. But with thanks to the character that I have gained (see above formula) I hope for the best. That last post was more of a purging of my feelings than a state of mind. I do feel wronged and hurt, but that is not who I am or what I live by. I have never crawled through life feeling sad and depressed (maybe if I did I would be a better musician! ZING!) So to review, I am me. I am Brent the Karateka. I fight and train to better myself and my mind. I serve a God that is bigger than shitty problems (Dissenting opinions please be respectful). I am blessed with parents that understand and talk with me, whilst pushing me to be better. I am happy by default, because being "depressed" is the exception, not the rule. I love everyone that was/is there for me when I need to talk (Meredith, Jamie, Im looking at you two) or party/laugh (Dave, Dustin...Woot). Please guys, when we have problems, lets not just pity each other. (IE "I know how you feel bro! Once I dated this girl for two weeks, and she TOTALLY broke my heart!!")(*Side note:Nigga please.) Lets encourage each other to do what Johnny Cash says: "Press on." (Yes Joe, I know its a Nam reference. But I wasnt IN nam, I just listen to Cash) In the words of Butters "Id rather be a whiny pussy than a faggy goth kid" But lifes too short to be a pussy Moving forward...never looking back, Brent
